string-array.name: HeroClass_EarthPonyPerks
string-array.item: Earth ponies are honest, cheerful, and durable, but are less kind and magical.
They begin with a unique Scythe that can later be reforged to upgrade another weapon.
Earth ponies are very good with melee weapons.
They can use bows, but they\'re much slower shooters than ponies who have wings or horns.
Eating a piece of food restores a small amount of health.
Earth Ponies automatically know Potions of Honesty.

string-array.name: HeroClass_UnicornPerks
string-array.item: Unicorns are generous and magical, but have a weak sense of humor.
They begin with a unique Wand of Mana Bolts that can later be reforged to upgrade another wand.
Unicorns can cast Telekinesis at will.
They can\'t equip a mane ring, however: their horn gets in the way of their forelock.
Eating a piece of food will restore 1 charge to all wands.
Unicorns can fully identify a wand just by using it, and automatically know Scrolls of Identify.

string-array.name: HeroClass_PegasusPerks
string-array.item: Pegasi are loyal and kind, but less generous and physically fragile.
They can fly over pits, spikes, and traps. Unlike levitation, flight still triggers special plants and hidden traps.
Encumbered pegasi cannot fly effectively, but they can still safely glide into pits.
They get a damage bonus for excess Loyalty when using thrown weapons.
Pegasi automatically know Scrolls of Loyal Oath and Magic Mapping.

string-array.name: HeroClass_ZebraPerks
string-array.item: Zebras are generous, magical, and durable, but less loyal.
They begin with a unique throwable boomerang that can be reused and upgraded.
Zebras excel with throwing weapons. They use honesty instead of loyalty to throw.
They can use bows, but they\'re much slower shooters than ponies who have wings or horns.
Zebras gain more health from dewdrops, and are immune to Rooting.

string-array.name: HeroClass_NightwingPerks
string-array.item: Nightwings are loyal and cheerful, but less honest and physically fragile.
They can fly over pits, spikes, and traps. Unlike levitation, flight still triggers special plants and hidden traps.
Encumbered nightwings cannot fly effectively, but they can still safely glide into pits.
They can sense neighboring creatures even when they are hidden behind obstacles.
Nightwings are good with bows, and can even use them at point-blank range.

resources.string: The _Farmer_ can gather dewdrops and seeds from special plants, and can go longer without food.
The _Bard_ uses Laughter to recover more quickly from negative effects. This won\'t help with effects that cause damage, like being on fire. (Fix this--doesn\'t laughter already do that?)
A successful attack with a melee weapon allows the _Royal Guard_ to start a combo, in which every additional hit inflicts bonus damage.
The _Magician_ can use her horn to cast Mana Bolts and Teleportation, in addition to Telekinesis (which is painful). Tapping monsters will automatically cast Mana Bolts unless a Bow is equipped.
The _Artist_ automatically detects cursed items, knows the ability of a ring upon wielding it, and can safely equip items with one fewer point of the necessary attribute.
By wearing a ring on her horn, the _Princess_ can use it as a weapon while gaining the ring\'s usual buff. Different rings produce different magical attacks.
The _Scout_ gains a bonus to damage when blindsiding a monster.
When the _Beastmaster_ attempts to hit an undamaged monster with a melee attack, there is a Kindness-based chance the monster will become a pet. This only works with animal monsters.
After flying unencumbered for a short distance, the _Thunderbolt_ gains a bonus to all attributes. The bonus lasts until one turn after the flight ends. (Tweak this.)
The _Shaman_ can brew potions more reliably, and he suffers no negative effects from eating seeds.

The _Seer_ can sense cursed items (resolve this with Artist at some point). All basic potion and scroll types are known to him. He can detect changelings on sight, which allows him to strike first. (And bonus? Tweak.)

Thrown weapon strikes from the _Enchanter_ have a Magic-based chance of inflicting a random negative status. Additionally, weapon and barding enchantments are chosen rather than randomly assigned. (The \'evil dances\' and \'pony stew\' rumors are somewhat exaggerated, however.)
The _Nocturne_ berserks when her health is low. This temporarily lowers her Kindness, but she deals significantly more damage.
The _Assassin_ has a Loyalty-based chance to completely bypass monster armor whenever she fires a Bow.
The _Vampony_ gains health and reduces hunger each time she defeats a monster. She also gains a boost to damage whenever she is hungry, but not starving. (Tweak to make cooler?)
